Headings: Underwriting Auction for sale of Government Securities for ₹28,000 crore on July 05, 2024
text_data: Government of India has announced the sale (re-issue) of Government Securities, as detailed below, through auctions to be held on July 05, 2024.As per the extant scheme of underwriting notified on November 14, 2007, the amounts of Minimum Underwriting Commitment (MUC) and the minimum bidding commitment under Additional Competitive Underwriting (ACU) for the underwriting auction, applicable to each Primary Dealer (PD), are as under:The underwriting auction will be conducted through multiple price-based method on July 05, 2024 (Friday). PDs may submit their bids for ACU auction electronically through Core Banking Solution (E-Kuber) System between 09:00 A.M. and 09:30 A.M. on the day of underwriting auction.The underwriting commission will be credited to the current account of the respective PDs with RBI on the day of issue of securities.Ajit Prasad          Deputy General Manager(Communications)    Press Release: 2024-2025/626
Summary: The Indian government has announced the sale of government securities through auctions on July 5, 2024. Primary dealers (PDs) are required to meet minimum underwriting commitments and minimum bidding commitments under additional competitive underwriting. The auction will be conducted through a multiple price-based method, and PDs can submit their bids electronically through the Core Banking Solution (E-Kuber) System. The underwriting commission will be credited to the respective PDs' current accounts with the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on the day of issue of securities. This press release is issued by Ajit Prasad, Deputy General Manager (Communications) of the RBI.
